cmp-lg.full_name: Computer Science – Logic in Computer Science
cmp-lg.definition: Research on the logical foundations of computer science, including formal methods, model checking, type systems, and theorem proving.

cond-mat.dis-nn.full_name: Condensed Matter – Disordered Systems and Neural Networks
cond-mat.dis-nn.definition: Studies on disordered physical systems and the application of neural networks to condensed matter physics.

cond-mat.stat-mech.definition: Theoretical and computational work on statistical properties of physical systems in condensed matter.

cs.AI.definition: Research on intelligent systems, including machine learning, planning, knowledge representation, and robotics.

cs.CC.definition: Studies on the inherent difficulty of computational problems and the resources needed to solve them.

cs.CE.full_name: Computer Science – Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science
cs.CE.definition: Application of computational methods to engineering problems, financial modeling, and scientific simulations.

cs.CG.definition: Research on algorithms and data structures for geometric objects and spatial data.

cs.CL.definition: Natural language processing, computational linguistics, and language modeling research.

cs.CR.definition: Work on cryptographic protocols, data privacy, cybersecurity, and secure computation.

cs.CV.full_name: Computer Science – Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition
cs.CV.definition: Research on image understanding, object detection, pattern recognition, and visual scene analysis.

cs.CY.definition: Studies on the impact of computing technology on society, ethics, and public policy.

cs.DB.definition: Research on database design, query optimization, data modeling, and information retrieval.

cs.DC.full_name: Computer Science – Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing
cs.DC.definition: Work on distributed systems, parallel computing, and large-scale computing infrastructures.

cs.DL.definition: Research on digital archiving, metadata, document retrieval, and library information systems.

cs.DM.definition: Application of discrete mathematical structures in algorithms, combinatorics, and graph theory.

cs.DS.full_name: Computer Science – Data Structures and Algorithms
cs.DS.definition: Fundamental studies on algorithm design, analysis, and efficient data organization techniques.

cs.FL.full_name: Computer Science – Formal Languages and Automata Theory
cs.FL.definition: Research on grammars, parsing, automata, and language recognition models.

cs.GT.full_name: Computer Science – Computer Science and Game Theory
cs.GT.definition: Analysis of strategic interactions using computational and economic principles.

cs.HC.definition: Design and evaluation of user interfaces, usability, and interactive technologies.

cs.IR.definition: Research on search engines, document ranking, and retrieval models for large datasets.

cs.IT.definition: Study of data compression, error correction, coding theory, and entropy.

cs.LG.definition: Research on algorithms and models that improve performance through experience.

cs.LO.full_name: Computer Science – Logic in Computer Science
cs.LO.definition: Same as cmp-lg, focusing on formal logic, proof theory, and reasoning systems in computing.

cs.MA.definition: Study of systems with multiple autonomous agents interacting in shared environments.

cs.MM.definition: Research on multimedia systems including audio, video, graphics, and content delivery.

cs.MS.definition: Design and implementation of software for mathematical modeling and symbolic computation.

cs.NA.definition: Work on numerical methods for solving mathematical problems on computers.

cs.NE.full_name: Computer Science – Neural and Evolutionary Computing
cs.NE.definition: Research on neural networks, genetic algorithms, and biologically inspired computation.

cs.NI.full_name: Computer Science – Networking and Internet Architecture
cs.NI.definition: Design and analysis of computer networks, protocols, and internet infrastructure.

cs.PF.definition: Evaluation and optimization of computer system performance, including benchmarking and profiling.

cs.PL.definition: Study of language design, compilers, interpreters, and programming paradigms.

cs.RO.definition: Development of autonomous robots, motion planning, and robotic perception.

cs.SC.definition: Use of symbolic mathematics in computing, including algebraic manipulation and theorem proving.

cs.SE.definition: Techniques and tools for designing, developing, testing, and maintaining software systems.

cs.SI.full_name: Computer Science – Social and Information Networks
cs.SI.definition: Analysis of social media, online communities, and network dynamics.

cs.SY.definition: Work on control systems, feedback loops, and system stability in computing applications.

math.CO.definition: Study of counting, arrangement, and combination structures in mathematics.

math.IT.definition: Mathematical foundations of information processing, coding, and transmission.

math.LO.definition: Research in formal logic, model theory, proof systems, and logical foundations of mathematics.

math.NA.definition: Study of numerical methods and algorithms for solving mathematical problems.

math.NT.definition: Theoretical research in properties and relationships of integers and prime numbers.

math.OC.definition: Techniques for optimizing objective functions and controlling dynamic systems.

math.PR.definition: Study of random processes, distributions, and probabilistic models.

math.ST.definition: Mathematical analysis of data, inference, hypothesis testing, and modeling uncertainty.

nlin.AO.full_name: Nonlinear Sciences – Adaptation and Self-Organizing Systems
nlin.AO.definition: Studies of dynamic systems that evolve through adaptation and self-organization.

physics.data-an.full_name: Physics – Data Analysis, Statistics and Probability
physics.data-an.definition: Application of statistical methods to experimental data analysis in physics.

physics.soc-ph.definition: Interdisciplinary studies on the impact of physics on social systems and human behavior.

q-bio.NC.definition: Quantitative studies of brain function, neural dynamics, and cognitive processes.

q-bio.QM.definition: Development of quantitative methods for studying biological phenomena and systems.

quant-ph.definition: Theoretical and experimental research on quantum systems, entanglement, and quantum computing.

stat.AP.definition: Application of statistical techniques to real-world problems across disciplines.

stat.ME.definition: Development and evaluation of statistical methods and frameworks.

stat.ML.definition: Intersection of statistics and machine learning, focusing on predictive modeling and inference.

stat.TH.definition: Mathematical theory underlying statistical inference, estimation, and hypothesis testing.
